text: Leopardus is a genus of small spotted cats that are native to Middle and South America. Very few species belonging to Leopardus are in the southern United States. Leopardus may be the oldest branch of the Felinae to go into the Americas, followed by the genera Lynx and Puma. ==Species== * Leopardus colocolo (Molina, 1782) - Colocolo * Leopardus braccatus (Cope, 1889) - Pantanal Cat * Leopardus pajeros (Desmarest, 1816) - Pampas Cat * Leopardus geoffroyi (d'Orbigny & Gervais, 1844) - Geoffroy's cat * Leopardus guigna (Molina, 1782) - Kodkod * Leopardus jacobitus (Cornalia, 1865) - Andean Mountain cat * Leopardus pardalis (Linnaeus, 1758) - Ocelot * Leopardus tigrinus (Schreber, 1775) - Oncilla * Leopardus wiedii (Schinz, 1821) - Margay Category:Felines
title: Leopardus
